Class BIFLexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • BIFLexer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BIFParser.Lexer

    public class BIFLexer
extends java.lang.Object
implements BIFParser.Lexer
    Scanner for the Bison-generate BIFParser. The scanner has to implement the Lexer inner interface of the parser class (Bison manual, Section 10.2.5). Token values are accessible as public static final ints in the parser class.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.StringBuilder buf
      Buffer used while reading tokens.

      The input to this BIFLxer, as a PushbackReader.
      protected int lastLineLen 
      protected int lineNum 
      protected java.lang.Object yylval
      The semantic value associated with the current lexical token.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BIFLexer

        public BIFLexer(java.io.InputStream input)
        Construct and return a new BIFLexer reading from the given InputStream. It would be easy to add variations on this, or even make it so you could change the input on the fly.

    • Method Detail

      • yyerror

        public void yyerror(java.lang.String s)
        Lexer method: Used to report an error message. As has been the case since the days of yacc, this is pretty useless since it only ever gets "syntax error" and can't throw an exception anyway because of the signature in the Lexer interface. But has to be defined.
        Specified by:
        yyerror in interface BIFParser.Lexer
        Parameters:
        s - The string for the error message.

      • getLVal

        public java.lang.Object getLVal()
        Return the semantic value associated with the current lexical token.
        Specified by:
        getLVal in interface BIFParser.Lexer
        Returns:
        the semantic value of the last scanned token.

      • yylex

        public int yylex()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Lexer method: Return the next token and set yylval appropriately. Returns 0 on EOF, -1 or error, otherwise a token code (>0).
        Specified by:
        yylex in interface BIFParser.Lexer
        Returns:
        the token identifier corresponding to the next token.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • error

        protected void error(java.lang.String msg)
              throws ParserException
        Report an error by throwing a ParserException. Probably should do something different now that we're in bison.
        Throws:
        ParserException

      • readChar

                throws java.io.IOException

      • recoverFromError

        public void recoverFromError()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Attempt to recover from the previous error, whetever it was. The strategy is to read up to and including a semi-colon. It might work (for simple errors).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • trace

        protected void trace(java.lang.String msg)
        Tracing for debugging.
